# Copilot Instructions

## Purpose
These instructions guide how to use GitHub Copilot effectively within the repository.

## Getting Started
1. Set up your development environment with the required dependencies and tools.
2. Go through the initial setup steps included in the documentation.

## Using Copilot
- Invoke Copilot through your editor (VS Code, JetBrains, etc.) by typing in code comments or starting a new function.
- Review suggestions carefully before integrating them into your codebase.

## Best Practices
- Use clear and descriptive comments to help Copilot understand your context better.
- Validate the suggestions against existing code and project standards.
- Iterate on the suggestions if they do not meet your requirements initially.

## Troubleshooting
- If Copilot is not providing relevant suggestions, check your comments and the context you provide.
- Ensure that your project is well-defined and that dependencies are properly installed to assist Copilot in generating useful output.
